intro: Biscutella valentina subsp. rotgesii, commonly known as the Valencian biscuit plant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a compact growth habit with hairy leaves. Its flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger leaves and more robust stems compared to other members of the species.
